detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
XMT section is ONLY for students who are REATTEMPTING this course. If you didn’t pass the course before, but you had a passing lab score, please register for a lecture, a lab and XMT wait list. 
 
Department will manually check your lab score and your eligibility for XMT. If eligible, students on the wait list will receive an email notification to accept the XMT spot. Once switched into XMT, your previous lab score will be reused.
 
If students mistakenly wait list for XMT, you will be removed from the wait list without further notice.
 
If students are attempting the course for the first time, please register for a lab, i.g. L06, L07, etc.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Placement Procedure -Prior to registration in any CHIN-titled courses, students are required to complete the Placement Procedure every Winter session or Summer Session and obtain a placement approval certificate for the courses they wish to register for. Students are only eligible for courses listed on their placement approval certificate. Students enrolled in sections which they do not have placement approval for will be removed from the course. 

Delivery Mode -This course has 4 instructional hrs/wk with 3hrs of lecture at the listed days and times and 1hr of Discussion. You must register in a Discussion section to complete your registration. If you have course conflicts with ALL Discussion sections, please register in Discussion section D99 AND email the OP Coordination Team (Chinese.OralPractice@ubc.ca) for possible accommodation.

Waitlist Policy - All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Placement Procedure -Prior to registration in any CHIN-titled courses, students are required to complete the Placement Procedure every Winter session or Summer Session and obtain a placement approval certificate for the courses they wish to register for. Students are only eligible for courses listed on their placement approval certificate. Students enrolled in sections which they do not have placement approval for will be removed from the course.

Delivery Mode -This course is fully online and has 4 instructional hours per week with 3hrs of Lecture at the listed days and times and 1hr of Oral Practice in Discussion Section. You must register in a Discussion Section to complete your registration. If you have course conflicts with ALL Discussion sections, please register in Discussion section D99 AND email the OP Coordination Team (Chinese.OralPractice@ubc.ca) for possible accommodation.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This is a Discussion section. You must register in both a Lecture and a Discussion Section to complete your registration. The Discussion section is used to conduct Oral Practice (OP). Both in-person and online Discussion sections are available but in-person sections prove to be more effective for Oral Practice purposes.

If you have course conflicts with ALL Discussion sections, please register in Discussion section D99 AND email the OP Coordination Team  (Chinese.OralPractice@ubc.ca) for possible accommodation.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Only register in this Discussion section, i.e. D99, if you have course scheduling time conflict with ALL of the Discussion sections above. Please also email the OP Tutorial Coordination Team(Chinese.OralPractice@ubc.ca) for possible accommodation. Please note only course scheduling time conflict will be accommodated.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding wait list section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Students must also sign up for a discussion section CINE 220 D21, D22, or D23. If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding wait list section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
